newsitem.title: USA: Foreign share of Japan chip market up, U.S. says.
newsitem.headline: Foreign share of Japan chip market up, U.S. says.

text.p: The foreign share of the Japanese semiconductor market rose to 27.1 percent in the 1996 third quarter from 26.4 percent in the second quarter, the U.S. government said Thursday.
"This increase in foreign share is a positive indication of continued success in penetrating the Japanese market," U.S. Trade Representative-designate Charlene Barshefsky said.
"The U.S. government will continue to monitor carefully access to this very important market," she said.
The market share assessment was made by the U.S. government only.
An expired 1991 chip trade agreement called on both the U.S. and Japanese governments to calculate and publicly report on market share.

A new agreement reached last August leaves it to the computer chip industry to collect data and share it with government officials. The agreement calls for more private industry cooperation to penetrate Japan's chip market.

Barshefsky said in a written statement that although the foreign share of Japan's chip market rose in the 1996 third quarter, it remained below the record 29.6 percent reached in the 1995 fourth quarter.
